lines.text: [first lines]
Orville, after you've finished flying the jet ships for the children, bring them back to the orphanage. Then cut the lawn and water the plants.
All right, Miss Planey.
I hereby claim Mars in the name of the United States of America.
Me too.
What kind of hot rod was that?
What is it?
I could be wrong, but I think it's a man.
That's a man?
[last lines]
She found me again.
How many states are you wanted in?
How many are dere?
Forty eight.
Dat's how many.

[Upon discovering a rocket that has just landed]
What's that?
If I didn't see with my own eyes, I wouldn't believe it.
What is it?
Are you kiddin'? That's a spaceship. Them guys weren't from Mardi Gras, they're from Mars.
What's Mars? Is that anywheres near Hoboken?
What's Mars! Mars is a planet. A planet is a thing that goes revolving around in space.
How did it get up there?
Well, it all depends whether you subscribe to the Laplacian theory of 1796 or whether you subscribe to the tidal theory formulated by somebody in 1919.
Gee, must be wonderful to have education.
